title: Backtesting - Educational Guide
content: Backtesting evaluates trading strategies using historical data. It shows how a strategy would have performed in the past. Important metrics: Total Return, Sharpe Ratio (risk-adjusted returns), Max Drawdown (largest peak-to-trough decline), Win Rate (percentage of profitable trades). Limitations of backtesting: 1) Past performance doesn't guarantee future results. 2) Curve fitting - over-optimizing for historical data. 3) Market conditions change. 4) Slippage and transaction costs may not be fully accounted for. Use backtesting for learning and strategy development, not as a guarantee of future profits. Fintra provides backtesting tools with 31-day historical data lag for educational purposes.
